alt_flag: Vertical triband (red, white, red) with a red maple leaf in the centre
national_motto:
{{native phrase|la|[[A Mari Usque Ad Mare]]|italics|=|on}}
{{small|"From Sea to Sea"}}
national_anthem:
"[[O Canada]]" {{lower|0.2em|efn| name|=|Anthem|1|=|Canada's de facto [[royal anthem]] is "[[God Save the Queen]]", which is sometimes played or sung together with the national anthem, "O Canada", at private and public events. Additionally, its first three lines are also included within the "Viceregal Salute", which is accorded to the governor general and provincial lieutenant governors. However, it has never been adopted as an official symbol of the country.|ref|{{cite web |last1=Kallmann |first1=Helmut |title=National and Royal Anthems |url=https://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.ca/en/article/national-and-royal-anthems-emc |website=The Canadian Encyclopedia |publisher=Historica Canada |accessdate=June 21, 2019}}||}}
{{efn| name|=|Anthem|1|=|Canada's de facto [[royal anthem]] is "[[God Save the Queen]]", which is sometimes played or sung together with the national anthem, "O Canada", at private and public events. Additionally, its first three lines are also included within the "Viceregal Salute", which is accorded to the governor general and provincial lieutenant governors. However, it has never been adopted as an official symbol of the country.|ref|{{cite web |last1=Kallmann |first1=Helmut |title=National and Royal Anthems |url=https://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.ca/en/article/national-and-royal-anthems-emc |website=The Canadian Encyclopedia |publisher=Historica Canada |accessdate=June 21, 2019}}|}} {{center|[[File:"O Canada", performed by the United States Third Marine Aircraft Wing Band.oga]]}}
